title: Does love bring happiness or pleasure? - Quora

response.answer_text: Love is a feeling space rather than a cerebral concept. It is therefore an experience rather than an intellectualization. Love is the word we use to represent feeling states, attitudes, pleasures, or strong affections felt for any number of things from romantic attachments to sexual attachments to platonic attachments. The usage of this one term “love” to cover all of these definitions as well as complex emotional states is partly responsible for the confusion most people alive today have with regards to the idea of love. It is the profound feeling space of total and complete oneness.  Happiness/pleasure/pain that may be associated by a person with love are just by-products of internal relationship with himself/herself.

Researchers in one 2012 study found that couples in the first stages of romantic attachment had significantly higher levels of oxytocin than their unattached counterparts. When people hug or kiss a loved one, oxytocin levels increase; hence, In fact, the hormone plays a huge role in all pair bonding. One review of research suggests that oxytocin has a positive impact on social behaviors related to: relaxationtrustoverall psychological stabilityThe hormone has also been shown to decrease stress and anxiety levels when released into certain parts of the brain.
